content: Maybe it was caused by a stored password. After removing the account via Account Settings, did you then access Account Settings > Privacy & Security > Saved Passwords and remove all passwords for the account you removed ? If no then it may still be stored in the profile data.

content:
A quando risale l'ultimo backup? Inoltre, Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)

Per l'anteprima premi il tasto F8
creator: @next

content: Sometimes thunderbird does create a new profile, but the old one should still be there. Try this - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll down to 'profiles' and click 'about:profiles' - see if your prior account is listed and click the 'launch' button to activate it
creator: davidsk

content:
Puzzling, as line wrap is a default. Does it worh with set to body text? This next suggestion may not work, but worth a try: - click settings>general and scroll to the bottom where there is a link to config editor - change mailnews.wraplength to 0 (zero) to make composed text messages wrap to the window width. save and close

The default is to wrap at line 72, but setting to zero is intended to wrap regardless of window size. Let us know.
creator: davidsk

content:
In Thunderbird 140.2.oesr heb ik opgegeven dat gecomprimeerd moet worden wanneer er meer dan 1000 Mb ruimte bespaard kan worden. Wanneer dit het geval is krijg ik voor het comprimeren een verzoek om het starten van het comprimeren toe te staan. Sinds enige tijd heb ik het volgende verschijnsel: Ik krijg bij iedere (!) opstart van Thunderbird het bericht dat b.v. 1,3 Gb bespaard kan worden. Ik geef akkoord en na enige tijd komt het bericht dat er b.v. 2 Mb is bespaard (??). Wanneer ik Thunderbird direct daarna afsluit en weer opstart, krijg ik het bericht dat er 1,4 Gb bespaard kan worden. Ik geef weer akkoord en krijg de boodschap dat er 0 Kb is bespaard. De ruimte die Thunderbird opgeeft die bespaard kan worden door te comprimeren wordt na iedere 'compress' weer hoger. >> Hoe kan dit gerepareerd worden ??

In https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/mappen-comprimeren kan ik hier niets over vinden.
creator: adri.vergalen

content: I encourage you to look in the profiles as that is the only place that has the answer. Locate the folder with the high usage. It's probably in imapmail\<imapaccount> folder. There may be other files there, such as detritus of failed compactions that can be quickly deleted. Post a screenshot of the contents of the large folder to get suggestions.

content: Are you asking why the profile in the CloudStation directory is so big? That would be a question for CloudStation people, not Thunderbird.
creator: mozilla98

content:
According to your screen shots, the number of either folders or files don't match between the Cloud and the User profile. Your screen shots does not show the entire figure, but the first digit does not match.

On the Cloud the first digit shows  : 8 On the User profile the first digit shows : 1

So you should compare those numbers.

Very likely one profile is configured as POP3(Cloud) and the other is configured as IMAP (Local).

content: Is this a daily issue, or if you shut down and restart the same thing happens? If this reset happens every time, I believe the issue is that the prefs.js file in the profile isn't being allowed to update. That may be caused by an antivirus program or a VPN, or it might be that the file is read-only. You can check that by clicking help>troubleshootinginformation, scroll down to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' and the prefs.js file will be one of the files listed there in the profile. If you see more than one, that may indicate a problem.
creator: davidsk

content: Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Open Folder, close TB, delete or rename session.json, restart TB a few times and see if the layout is preserved. A different method is needed for the MS Store version.

Can you post your Troubleshooting Information? At the top right of the Thunderbird window, click the menu button ≡, then select Help > Troubleshooting Information. Press the "Copy text to clipboard button" and paste the information into your reply.

Also, at the exception prompt, click 'View'. That should open a new Certificate Viewer tab. Please post a screenshot with the certificate details.

content: If it's just your addressbook, click to addressbook pane, highlight the addressbook, click the three dots to the right and select export in your choice of several formats. If your intent is to replace the addressbook on another PC with thunderbird, just copy the abook.sqlite and history.sqlite fron the profile and pasted into the receiving profile. That 2 gig limit is for the entire profile.
creator: davidsk
